page.title: 04Historical Features
page.content:
Corps and is owned by the Ministry of the Environment.All that remains of the Palace today is the Great Hall,the Moat-bridge and numerous foundations which are the focus of current excavations.
Anna McCord-Crown Woods School Eltham.
Eltham appears as Alteham in the Domesday book of 1086 and boasts a palace where the kings of England were often in residence in the 15th and 16th centuries.But it was the coming of the railway which caused Eltham to grow from a small village to a sizeable town,doubling its population between 1891 and 1911.There is a large area of housing alongside the railway dating from this time,and further expansion took place between the two wars.
